citeinfo.title: EnviroAtlas - Above Ground Live Tree Biomass Carbon Storage by 12-Digit HUC for the Conterminous United States - Forested

pubinfo.publish: U.S. EPA Office of Research & Development (ORD) - National Exposure Research Laboratory (NERL)

idinfo.useconst: None. Please check sources, scale, accuracy, currency and other available information. Please confirm that you are using the most recent copy of both data and metadata. Acknowledgement of the EPA would be appreciated.

descript.abstract:
This EnviroAtlas dataset includes the sum of aboveground live dry biomass estimate by 12-digit Hydrologic Unit (HUC) in total metric tons (megagrams) from the 2000 National Biomass and Carbon Dataset (Version 2.0) developed by the Woods Hole Research Center and released in October 2012.
This dataset was produced by the US EPA to support research and online mapping activities related to EnviroAtlas. EnviroAtlas (https://www.epa.gov/enviroatlas) allows the user to interact with a web-based, easy-to-use, mapping application to view and analyze multiple ecosystem services for the contiguous United States. The dataset is available as downloadable data (https://edg.epa.gov/data/Public/ORD/EnviroAtlas) or as an EnviroAtlas map service. Additional descriptive information about each attribute in this dataset can be found in its associated EnviroAtlas Fact Sheet (https://www.epa.gov/enviroatlas/enviroatlas-fact-sheets).
descript.purpose:
This dataset is useful for evaluating the potential value of ecosystem services provided by vegetation communities.
The overall goal of EnviroAtlas is to employ and develop the best available science to map indicators of ecosystem services production, demand, and drivers for the nation.

cntperp.cntorg: U.S. Environmental Protection Agency, Office of Research and Development-Sustainable and Healthy Communities Research Program, EnviroAtlas

dataqual.logic: Tests for integrity have not been performed.
dataqual.complete: Features represented have not been tested for completeness

horizpa.horizpar: Data were collected using methods that have unknown accuracy (EPA National Geospatial Data Policy [NGDP] Accuracy Tier 10). For more information, please see EPA's NGDP at https://www.epa.gov/geospatial/geospatial-policies-and-standards

procstep.procdesc: Extract and mosaic all 66 30m biomass rasters to a single raster
Using National Land Cover Database (NLCD) 2011 grid, set areas of "VALUE" = 0 to NULL using Set Null tool using combined raster as false raster input

Execute Zonal statistics as table, using HUC12 as zones to summarize raster with SUM as the statistics type. (Cell values are mean biomass in kg/m2, multiplied by ten to preserve significant digits.) Divide the sum by 10. The result is the sum of the mean kg/m2 for the HUC12.
Multiply the sum by 900 to convert from the summed mean kg/m2 to the total kg for the HUC12 (original raster values were means in kg/m2 for 900 square meter cells).
Divide by 1000 to convert to metric tons (megagrams).

cntorgp.cntorg: U.S. Environmental Protection Agency, Office of Research and Development-Sustainable and Healthy Communities Research Program, EnviroAtlas

metainfo.metstdn: FGDC Content Standard for Digital Geospatial Metadata

cntorgp.cntorg: U.S. Environmental Protection Agency, Office of Research and Development-Sustainable and Healthy Communities Research Program, EnviroAtlas

enttyp.enttypd: Sum of aboveground live dry biomass estimate for the 12-digit Hydrologic Unit in metric tons from the 2000 National Biomass and Carbon Dataset v.2 developed by the Woods Hole Research Center

attr.attrdef: Twelve Digit Hydrologic Unit Code. This field provides a unique 12-digit code for each subwatershed. Numbers were assigned in an upstream to downstream fashion. Where no downstream/upstream relationship could be determined, numbers were assigned in a clockwise fashion.
attr.attrdefs: Federal Guidelines, Requirements, and Procedures for the National Watershed Boundary Dataset; Chapter 3 of Section A; Federal Standards, Book 11, Collection and Delineation of Spatial Data; Techniques and Methods 11-A3.

attr.attrdef: Total estimated aboveground live dry biomass for the 12-digit Hydrologic Unit in metric tons (megagrams).

overview.eaover:
These metrics describe the amount of carbon stored in the aboveground biomass of forests. The metric was generated using ArcMap 10.4 in conjunction with National Biomass and Carbon Dataset for the year 2000 v2 (NBCD2000) released in October of 2012. The NBCD dataset is a high-resolution (30 m), year-2000 baseline estimate of basal area-weighted canopy height, aboveground live dry biomass, and standing carbon stock for the conterminous United States. For EnviroAtlas, the NBCD 30 m resolution data were aggregated to the 12-digit HUC level.
For more information on the metric calculation, please see the Woods Hole Research Center Internet site.
